explanation:
- charsequalcaseless: called from the target on each character; you must inspect its implementation to see whether it does per-character comparisons (harmless) or hides a call to memcmp or other string-level comparison (which could violate the MISRA rule).
- isasciiupper: a callee of charsequalcaseless (per the static call graph). If charsequalcaseless is a thin wrapper that uses character-class helpers or macros, their implementations may affect whether memcmp or other forbidden library string comparisons are used or synthesized.
- memcmp: the Standard Library function prohibited by the MISRA rule. Include it so the analyzer can detect any direct or indirect use (calls or macros that expand to it) in the chain from the target to its callees.
